revision.comment: Created page with "Possibly: The Young Gentleman and Lady Instructed in such Principles of Politeness, Prudence, and Virtue, as will lay a sure Foundation for gaining Respect, Esteem, and Satisf..."
revision.text: Possibly: The Young Gentleman and Lady Instructed in such Principles of Politeness, Prudence, and Virtue, as will lay a sure Foundation for gaining Respect, Esteem, and Satisfaction in the Life, and Eternal Happiness in a future State; Interspersed with such Observations and Maxims, as demonstrate the Danger and Folly of Vice, and, the Advantage and Wisdom of Virtue. (London : Printed only for Edward Wicksteed, at the Black Swan in Newgate-street, near Newgate-Market, 1747.) http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2406682~S1
